website_summaries.verdict: A sleek design and fast transfer speeds make this both a stylish and practical drive at a reasonable price.
pros: Stylish and sturdy, with a very low profile
The plastic end makes for easy removal, particularly when the drive gets hot
cons: While it doesn’t affect performance, the drive can get quite hot
Lack of a connector cover may turn off some users

customer_reviews.title: Good buy SanDisk... I am done with this brand.
customer_reviews.text: I am actually always a SanDisk fan, use all my memory cards this brand. I have about 5 cards and drive total. They were great before until recently... I am using this drive in the car for music only. Also brought another 128gb samsung at the same time. No problem with the samsung. Just like other reviewer mentioned, this particular 128gb sandisk runs super hot. Worse of all. This card skips music randomly... I know because I swap this with the samsung between 2 cars, and it seem to happen only on this card, so it's not the car.... I have another SD card that is SanDisk which I used for camera only. Also starting to having issues with it....
customer_reviews.author: A. Lin

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: This drive gets HOT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been impressed with the size and speed of the drive so far, and it works great as a keychain, but the drive itself gets VERY hot and is difficult to touch, especially closer to the port. I would recommend gripping the back of the drive near the plastic loop when removing the drive from your computer. Just thought I would warn everyone since I could see getting burned.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: This flash drive gets ridiculously hot
customer_reviews.text: WARNING: This flash drive gets ridiculously hot if you are transferring large files (> 30 GB). If the flash drive gets too hot (if it surpasses operating temperature) then it will eject itself from the computer. This flash drive is practically useless to me as I need to transfer 30+ GB file sizes. Because it gets too hot easily, it will disconnect itself before the transfers are finished. If you only need to transfer small files (< 10GB) at a time then this works perfectly fine. But if you work with large files like I do then save your money and find a better flash drive that can handle heat.
customer_reviews.author: Ian A.

customer_reviews.title: Fast and large enough to run VHDX's for demo purposes on your laptop.
customer_reviews.text: I run Hyper-V on my Windows 10 laptop that has an SSD with 16GB RAM and Core i7 processor. I keep my WIndows 2012R2 VHDX's on the SanDisk USB 3.0 Flas Drive for SSD performance on my Hyper-V servers! It gets a little warm, within spec they say, but to keep it cool I stuck some heatsinks for a Rasp-Pi on it. Since the case is metal, heat transfer is excellent and I no longer worry about the temp of my external, thumb-sized SSD!
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied-Customer

customer_reviews.title: 16GB Drive totally failed in 1 week!  Also gets almost as hot as an old-style light bulb!  Now total junk.
customer_reviews.text: Drive totally failed in 1 week from delivery by Amazon! Drive suddenly failed in a few seconds while in use. Went from working great to totally dead! Cannot be recognized by Linux Gparted utility or by Windows Disk Management partition tool. While it worked, it worked great. But it failed beyond any chance to repair/reformat/repartition. My guess is that these drives get too hot for longevity. Amazon gave me a refund so no worries there. Although it is amazing it is even possible to have 16GB storage in that tiny form factor. Still - should last more than a week!
customer_reviews.author: The Other Geek

customer_reviews.title: Bad USB stick/Overheating
customer_reviews.text: Upon testing this USB stick, I can safely say It does not work in USB 3.0 slot, I have multiple devices to test this and in all, the stick is only recognizedy in 2.0 slot. Other USB 2.0 sticks work in 3.0 slot but not this one Update: Ordered a brand new flash drive. USB 3.0 slot works. This time overheating issue while transfering. Overheated too much and failed few times while transfering files. Do not recommend at all
customer_reviews.author: Dariusz

customer_reviews.title: What's the point of 128GB and USB3 if it's gonna take ALL day to write the files?!?!?!?
customer_reviews.text: VERY SLOW WRITES! For a drive that can read over 100MB/s, writing at such slow speeds is pretty ridiculous! I just got the drive today and are transferring over 80GB of video files. It started out somewhat acceptable writing around 35MB/s. But since has slowed to 11.7MB/s. My old 1GB and 2GB thumb drives from back who knows when writes faster than this!!! And as I conclude this review its down to 11.3MB/s. And these are not a million tiny files because I know that can artificially reduce the posted transfer rate. Keep in mind these are large video files (500MB to 6GB), so these are pretty much sustained transfer rates. Pretty sad Sandisk! SAD!!!!
customer_reviews.author: inky

customer_reviews.title: Hot and slow. Writes: 10MB/s  reads: 90MB/s
customer_reviews.text: Needed a large drive quickly, should have read the reviews first! There seems to be a buffer so the first 500MB write at 30MB/s, then slows to 10 for the remainder of the file. Reads are a reasonable 90MB/s.. It will get hot during writing, If you squeeze the drive, you won't be able to keep touching it after a few seconds, that's how hot. Concerned about what the heat will do to my USB port. No more SanDisk drives for me, the last one was similarly slow.
customer_reviews.author: Joesab

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 9 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this thing in oct 2016. It's now dead, cant be formatted, data is gone...9 month life span, I'd be embarrassed if I was SanDisk. This is the first thumb drive that has every failed before I either bought an upgrade or lost it....and I don't lose thumbs often, maybe I'm just lucky. I still have smaller gb ones from ages ago...they still work. I was using this to transfer videos my son makes to a different computer....used it maybe once a week. Before it died it got very hot when in use perhaps the heat did this thing in...looking for a replacement now..... from a different company
customer_reviews.author: R.E.

customer_reviews.title: ⚠️Defect Warning ⚠️
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this on April 5th, it’s now June 15th, so it’s been a little over two month. I started noticing some memory issues earlier this week, it would essentially forget things, so I backed everything up yesterday. Today I tried to use the flash drive and it’s completely unusable, it won’t connect to the computer at all. There is a Sandisc acknowledgement article that basically says if the flash drive starts saying “write protect” it’s dying and you better get a new one. This is not worth the money spent. Two months of use isn’t great.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: SLOW.
customer_reviews.text: This drive is so slow. It takes 1-2 seconds to click on a dang folder. I use a sandisk Ultra Fit 64GB USB3.0 thumb drive to compile a C++ program of about 80 files which reside on the USB drive. Both drives formatted for exFAT Ultra Fit - 2-3 minutes. Ultra Flair (This drive) - 10-20 minutes I really want a replacement for an Ultra Fit this drive is TERRIBLE performant
customer_reviews.author: Squid

customer_reviews.title: Very bad performance on Mac Pro
customer_reviews.text: Got one of these, returned it for a replacement, which acts the same. It's going back, not getting any more of these. As packaged, the formatting somehow cuts performance to approximately USB 2 speeds. Not what I paid for. Reformat with Disk Utility, and the speed improves to USB 3 specs, but then the thing overheats and self-ejects after a few minutes of intense activity. Catch 22. Their legal department should worry about this thing. When driven to full speed, it gets just about hot enough to burn your fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: WTH!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this usb drive to create a recovery drive for my new laptop. After the backup was done, I pulled the drive out and threw it! This SanDisk USB 3.0 Flash Drive actually burned me to the the extent I actually had to apply an ointment on my fingers to relieve the pain. Now I'm not sure if it did the job copying the drive without melting/burning/malfunctioning out the components inside the flash drive. If not, it must be fire proof!
customer_reviews.author: Luis R.

customer_reviews.title: LIES! IS ONLY A USB 2.0 stick!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Is really only USB 2 speeds. I tried transferring large files to this drive, and for the first few seconds, it transfers them at ~30MB/s, which is quite great! However, after about 10-20 seconds, the speeds drop to 12MB/S. This is only USB2 speeds. Filling up half the drive took 20 minutes (~45 minutes to fill the entire drive). I also bought it, thinking the entire drive would have been out of Aluminum (better cooling), however the back is plastic. I'll use this in my car, and the temps of it being on for long times, gets quite hot.
customer_reviews.author: H B

customer_reviews.title: Works Just Fine
customer_reviews.text: I use this flash on my nvidia shield running KODI to play back FLAC music files. Copying 108 GB of music from my SSD based PC to the SanDisk recorded an average write speed of 25.7 MB/s. The other 128 GB SANDisk works just as well fully loaded with vacation pictures used for the screen saver. I have several SANDisk flash drives and I am very satisfied. I like this drive as it has a metal case. I also use an external USB fan positioned over it when performing a large data transfer to the flash. This might be overkill but cooling never hurts.
customer_reviews.author: Ethics in Review

customer_reviews.title: This work great for about one day
customer_reviews.text: This work great for about one day. Now instead of 128GB to shows up as 2.4MB, doesn't matter what computer I use to access it or what OS (I've tried Ubuntu as well as Windows, 8 and 10) it always shows that it's storage is less than than 3MB. Huge waste of money. Do not buy. I have had great luck with ScanDisk flash drives in the past but would recommend getting a different model.
customer_reviews.author: James Uldrich

customer_reviews.title: It's a desert sloth (slow and hot)
customer_reviews.text: While the read speed of 105 MB/s is okay, it's write speed of 13 MB/s is terrible. It took me four hours to transfer a 71 GB file for a client, which is somewhat embarrassing. It gets hot as blazes, too. Apparently the friction of data moving slowly generates a lot of heat. This is the second SanDisk product I've gotten lately that has disappointed. Time to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Chris L

customer_reviews.title: PAID FOR 128 GB RECEIVED32 GB
customer_reviews.text: I ordered three 128 GB USB 3.0 thumb drives. When they arrived, I opened one and used it to back up my computer. When finished I found it was really only a 32 GB drive even though the package is labeled as 128 GB. I wiped it and returned all 3 to Amazon and bought a different brand. There is no labeling on the drive itself, only on the blister package. Not blaming AMAZON, they gave me fast and courteous service, evidently a manufacturers labeling error.
customer_reviews.author: R DAVIS

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money - MISREPRESENTED as USB 3.0 - No Way!
customer_reviews.text: This is another example of a major brand taking advantage of buyers' ignorance and misrepresenting their product as USB 3.0 when it can't even achieve and sustain USB 1.0 speed! When you test these Ultra-series 64GB flash drives, you get about 25MB/s write speed for about 1GB of initial capacity and THEN... They grind to a halt for the balance of the 64GB capacity and struggle to achieve 1-2MB/s! That's absolutely USELESS and total fraud! AVOID THESE LYING FRAUDULENT CLAIMED-BY-SANDISK-To-Be-USB3 flash drives. They are a TOTAL RIPOFF!
customer_reviews.author: Trusting Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t work on many machines!
customer_reviews.text: Bought several of these to write as bootable iso’s for upgrading servers. Should have known when several Dell laptops had trouble seeing the thumb drives something was up. Eventually realized adding physical pressure to the tops while inserted was the only way for these to be recognized by the OS. Once written had similar problems with the servers detecting that anything was inserted into the usb slot. Benchmark scores had these ranked pretty high, but will likely have to throw these out and eat the loss. Will certainly think twice before buying SanDisk again!
customer_reviews.author: YottaBytes

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt store data for retrieval/transfer
customer_reviews.text: I copied my favorite music to this drive to carry around with me and use in my new car, which only had USB inputs. I always had trouble finding my songs and attributed it to not being familiar with the car or the car simply being poorly designed. Recently I tried using it on a desktop and a laptop and it kept failing to connect, disconnecting and losing files there as well; may have to apologize to the car!
customer_reviews.author: Flybob

customer_reviews.title: OK, but not great
customer_reviews.text: As noted it gets hot but not enough to burn. When I tested it the speed climbed up to 70 mb/sec but then dropped to around 30 for the remainder of a 4gb transfer. So performance on large transfer is not so good. I was considering sending it back but what i need it for does not need large transfers. Plus looking at a lot of other USB 3.0 reviews that also have slow write performance it seems ok for the price. If you need a USB flash drive for large data transfers then go with something more expensive with better performance.
customer_reviews.author: A. Brown

customer_reviews.title: 5 year warranty (if you can go through hoops)
customer_reviews.text: When you state you offer a 5 year warranty on a product, the provision of the proof of purchase should be enough to secure your coverage. This does not seem to be the case for SanDisk. I am a professional computer technician by trade and this was stated during a live chat with an agent. This fact did not prevent SanDisk to ask consumer level questions such as "did you insert the drive correctly? ..." or "have you tried rebooting your computer? ..." Then, they wanted unreadable serial numbers and model numbers ... In sum, every possible loophole NOT TO ACCEPT your valid return of their defective product. So, no more SanDisk USB drives for me.
customer_reviews.author: Adelmar Edison Sutra

customer_reviews.title: The single slowest flash drive I have ever seen in my life
customer_reviews.text: I'm copying files from a hard drive to this 256GB flash drive, I have never seen speeds this slow, I mean maybe back around 1990, I can't really remember though. What a total waste. I have around 20 USBs and this was my first SanDisk 256GB, I keep looking at it seeing if they shipped a usb 2.0 by mistake, no it's a 3.0, but IT IS SO SLOW. I'm getting a maximum of 3.5 MB/second. I'm copying a bunch of files that add up to 90GB, it's been going for 3 hours and it says 8 hours to go...
customer_reviews.author: WS_McGill_Montreal

customer_reviews.title: Working nice-somewhat higher temperature is expected, despite other reviews
customer_reviews.text: Working as expected. After a large file transfer on a usb 3 port, it was a little warm, but not too bad. Faster transfer rates will result in higher temperatures. Having designed electronics for a career: if the parts inside are getting warm, the best way to get the heat out is using metal. With plastic, the part inside will be hotter and the outside of the plastic will be cooler. Also, for plastic at the same temperature as metal, the metal will feel hotter to the touch since it transmits heat to your finger faster. I suspect the metal case is simply doing its job keeping the parts inside cool, but people are used to plastic sticks.
customer_reviews.author: SRP

customer_reviews.title: Extreme heat/Very slow write speed
customer_reviews.text: Data write speed starts at about 40mb/s. Drops to around 20mb/s in less than a minute and stays there. In that time temperature spikes to the point the device is very uncomfortable to the touch. The 150mb/s write speeds advertised are pure fiction.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Not 128GB!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't confirm the 1st flash drive was only 31.9gb since it was crushed in shipment. Asked for a replacement and got the new drive a few days later. I transferred some files and check the properties of the drive and it said 31.9gb. I took an older 8gb flash drive I had laying around to make sure it wasn't the USB port and it was 8gbs. In seraching the reviews I found someone from 2016 had the same issue. I reached out to Amazon for a price adjustment (128 to 32), but since I had already started the return i couldn't. I bought another brand and had no issue.
customer_reviews.author: Niecy Peaches

customer_reviews.title: Crummy product, broke in less than a month..
customer_reviews.text: Less than a month into using this drive it broke. The part that actually connects to the computer fell out of the casing, probably would have been fine if I'd noticed it'd come out when I removed my drive but when I went to plug it in the next day all that was left was the metal casing and not the actual 'drive' portion I needed. I'm not hard on my electronics or storage devices so this was very disappointing. Not to mention all the lost files on the inner portion that came out.
customer_reviews.author: Bakmag10

customer_reviews.title: Great storage for Photography!
customer_reviews.text: As a photographer I have given about 500 of these to my clients over the last three years and the just work. I havent seen one single failure yet and they are fast! USB 3.0 gets great transfer rates. because they have a metal case they do get hot while in use. Dont be alarmed. Plastic case drive do that too you just feel it because the plastic insulates. Anyway 300 and no failures is great track record.
customer_reviews.author: Davinphx

customer_reviews.title: Finally, an advancement in central heating technology!
customer_reviews.text: update 2020/05/22: my little heater died today :( but at least it got me through 2 winters! I purchased this flash drive after reading all the reviews complaining about how hot it gets. Let me tell you, this little thing is great for heating small houses. I've hooked it up to a raspberry pi in the basement and wrote a shell script that copies files to and from the drive constantly, which should maintain an average ambient temperature of 3860 Kelvin, providing enough warmth to heat the entire house this coming winter season. I am considering buying one more for the garage, but it might be overkill...I wouldn't want to attract unwanted attention from the local fire department.
customer_reviews.author: bobbeh

customer_reviews.title: Awful, would not even open!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for a W10 PC. Neither would even open. Got the loading, loading, loading graphic which never finished. Frankly, I am shocked. Never, ever had a problem with San Disk before. Now, two in a row that simply DO NOT WORK at all! Probably smarter to buy an external ssd drive or something than these if you have big files to store.
customer_reviews.author: LLTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I haven't benched these drives since first purchasing them, but at that time, they performed extremely well on paper and in practice, and even now they seem to be treating me well. They *do* feel hot to the touch during use, but I can hardly dock them a star for that; electronics produce heat, after all, and since the shell is aluminum, the heat conductivity is more noticeable. All in all, I think these little buggers are a good value. I can't speak for the performance degradation others are fussing over just yet, however I may update my review if I see this down the road. In any case, I'd recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Used once to install an OS, died after second usage.
customer_reviews.text: Worked as expected the first usage, but the second time I went to use it, just randomly stopped working and is no longer readable by any computer or device. I had noticed It was extremely hot and I'm just glad it had not damaged the USB port on my computer or aftermarket stereo as I was intending to use it for music. I would have been devastated if it had broken the only USB port on my deck. Stay far away from this, it's not worth risking your USB ports on your likely very expensive devices.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Baltz

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good flash drive but forget the encryption software that comes with it.
customer_reviews.text: It is quite small and easily fits on my key chain, but it doesn't come with a cover to keep dirt out. The encryption software is pure crap; a free seemingly beta program that is there to get you to buy an upgrade. It is slow and not intuitive. The encrypted folders are not hidden from view. Basically you get a free sample of encryption software I certainly wouldn't pay to upgrade after trying it. If you want encryption on a flash drive, the Kingston Datatraveler Vault is the way to go. Alternately there are a number of third party encryption programs that are much-much better than what Sandisk provides with this drive.
customer_reviews.author: Ancient DIY'er

customer_reviews.title: Fast with low durability
customer_reviews.text: 1 out of the 6 I ordered only works intermitently. When it is read by the computer it is fast. It appears as though the internal contacts are wearing off after about 6 months of daily use. I have to fuss with it when I plug it in to get it to read. Great product with low durability. I ordered the remaining drives for members of my project team. If they have issues I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: David C

customer_reviews.title: Great size, works well... but plastic loop?
customer_reviews.text: PHYSICAL SIZE: Small enough to not be cumbersome, large enough to not lose. DIGITAL SIZE/SPEED: Not stand out here... they're all about the same. It is a 3.0, so it'll be faster than a 2.0. BUILD: My only complaint... the black portion is plastic. I leave a USB drive on my keys full time. I specifically chose one that had no moving parts, no caps, no tethers/strings, and the meat of it attached straight to the large hook/loop. I'm REALLY hoping the plastic holds up. I'll be extra vigilant about backing it up... and might replace it sooner rather than later for one more similar to the 2nd USB drive in my pics, which is one solid piece of metal.
customer_reviews.author: D. Voo.

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap drive
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 16 GB version of this flash drive because I needed a fast(er) drive to use as a Windows 10 install USB. This will work perfectly for that. As others have mentioned, the drive gets unusually hot very quickly and this is a bit concerning. I can see how this would cause the drive to fail more quickly during regular, everyday use. I do not recommend this drive to anyone who needs to store important information or who will rely on using the drive daily. For something like a Windows 10 install USB (will be used only a few times a year, at most), though, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Forbis

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the number of reviews fool you! After a few months of use drive will get too hot and fail permanently!
customer_reviews.text: Awful usb drives! I owned two for my business and both on different occasions after 2 hours of use became very hot and disconnected permanently! Paid a substantial amount of money to recover my data but only a small percentage was recoverable through my laptop itself as the usbs were permanently damaged! Has put me back significantly and I will truly never purchase ANY sandisk product again!
customer_reviews.author: boriqat

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioned
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for about a year. I was using it as a Windows To Go (WTG) drive. It ran reasonably well. Then it crapped out. It didn't die, exactly. I thought it did, but a week or two later it passed various diagnostics. But it did completely fail to function as a WTG drive, in the middle of a session, for no particular reason: I wasn't running anything especially demanding at the time. At present, I am happier with the speed and performance of the Samsung MUF FIT Plus USB drives. They seem much faster and, so far, have not let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Woodcock

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Just combine all the bad reviews, dead, slow, gets hot, etc and that is what you get Online Return Material Authorization(RMA) Request SUBMISSION & WARRANTY DETAILS SANDISK WARRANTY Submitting an online Warranty Replacement request does NOT guarantee that your submission will be processed and approved for Return Merchandise Authorization (RMA). Please refer to the SanDisk Warranty page for information on your product's warranty. Further information on additional SanDisk warranty replacement process options is also available
customer_reviews.author: jg

customer_reviews.title: Dissappointed by this brand name USB
customer_reviews.text: It is very tiny and feels plastic-ey. Te size of the prong going into the usb is the size of the base sticking out. It took me 2 to 3 hours to copy 77GB from my computer. By comparison, I bought another off brand thumb drive with similar specs (Netac) It felt sturdier and it took less than 1 1/2 hours to copy the same 77GB.
customer_reviews.author: G. Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and it Actually Works
customer_reviews.text: Recently I have purchased a number of low priced flash drives from amazon and elsewhere that turned out to be scams/fake drives. I am happy to say that this drive actually works and it really is a 16 gigabyte drive (about 14.5 usable, which is typical). I took off 1 star because it is not as fast as it claimed to be -- but it is pretty fast, I saw about 35MB read speed. Also I had to reformat it to get it to work properly with my computer. Bottom Line: Despite minor gripes, I am very happy with this drive, it is a great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: iskum kloshe

customer_reviews.title: The lack of speed isn't worth the price
customer_reviews.text: It's advertised as up to 150MB/s, but even with a super fast bus and super fast SSDs, we can't get it to HALF of that advertised speed. The most we have been able to get it 67MB/s, and that's with one large file reading from the device. Write speed is even worse, topping out at 42MB/s. Consider these real world speeds before making the purchase. The small size, on the other hand, is nice. But the speeds just don't live up to expectations at all.
customer_reviews.author: North Carolina Consumers Council

customer_reviews.title: Dead after about a year
customer_reviews.text: Used in my Tesla Model 3 for the dash cam feature. Dash cam stopped working in the middle of a trip. I took the drive back to my computer to try to reformat it and it is stuck in a "read only" mode - apparently a common failure mode for this drive. While I only paid about $16 for the drive, it's not the money I'm concerned about, it's that the drive failed when I needed it to work. I'd happily pay more money for a drive that would last a reasonable period of time. I'll be staying away from SanDisk for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Elemeno

customer_reviews.title: Great storage device for the price
customer_reviews.text: I really like the construction of this flash drive. It feels solid in your hand unlike some other plastic drives that feel like they would break if you shoved it in your pocket. Performance wise, this flash drive does the trick, although all I use it for is transferring visual studio files between computers. I cant speak to life expectancy yet as it is a new product, but I've had a good run of luck with this manufacture. The amount if storage for the price is great in my eyes, who doesn't need an affordable 128GB flash drive right.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Never plastic again
customer_reviews.text: I have never before been dissatisfied with a true SanDisk product, and as always the memory here worked flawlessly for about a year. However, there is one major design flaw with this specific thumb drive, that thin plastic loop that is barely held on by two tiny plastic hooks that one day will eventually break, and it will just disappear off your keychain. Luckily I did use their encryption software so whoever has found it,... good luck with that. Great memory, bad design. I will likely buy a SanDisk replacement, however, I will never buy another one with a plastic keychain hoop. SanDisk FYI, if this exact design had a metal hoop you'd have gotten 300 stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: AlexCphoto

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised, Good bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: 7 bucks for a 16gb USB 3.0 drive? I remember when a drive like this with USB 2.0 would cost over a hundred bucks. Man, how times have changed. Anyway, I used this as a windows 10 boot installer and it works great! Also, I'm pretty sure the install was faster than my USB 2.0 installer. I'd recommend it and buy again.
customer_reviews.author: G_Tech

customer_reviews.title: Got hot
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Smart TVs that support a “pause live tv” function. It takes the video and stuffs it onto a drive. I recently switched to an over the air antenna .... Durocher channel scan, the option came up to set this up, you need a stick drive, enter this product. I have ANOTHER NAME BRAND SMART TV that has 3usb slots and one marked as SSD. I tried the drive and it only functions as additional storage for the TVapps and functions. The drive got really hot during this TVs formatting function. That is the warning... it got hot to the touch and that may have hurt it. I don’t know
customer_reviews.author: C. Rumfield

customer_reviews.title: Low Price. Great Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great little flash drive. SanDisk has never let me down when it comes to memory cards and flash drives. I love the modern design and the compact size. For the price, you cannot get any better. The speed is fast. My video and image files quickly transfer. The Flash Drive does get a little warm when using. I just make sure not to leave it plugged in when not in use. Not a big deal. It easily attaches to a keyring and has been quite durable getting banged around constantly. I highly recommend this flash drive. Low price and great quality.
customer_reviews.author: MelissaTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: So small yet so big!
customer_reviews.text: Lots of portable storage space for your uncensored media! Great read speeds, not so great write speeds. One freaky thing is, this thing gets quite hot when it's not transferring files and is just plugged in and idling. Comes formatted in FAT32, so you might want to reformat it to exFAT if you plan to put 4+GB files into it. The SLIM profile means that it will reach pretty much ANY USB port, especially on Tablets that have protective cases such as my Surface 4, where the shell blocks most USB sticks.
customer_reviews.author: The Amazonian Man

customer_reviews.title: Overheats and Extremely Slow During Large File Transfers.
customer_reviews.text: This flash drive overheats and extremely slow during large file transfers. I have 2.0 flash drives that are faster for larger files and 3.0 flash drives that leave this SanDisk Ultra Flair in the dust. I wouldn't recommend this flash drive to anyone; except, to someone who is only transferring tiny files in tiny chunks. I am very disappointed with this sub-par product and regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: 4K4Me

customer_reviews.title: SLOW -- speed not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Like others have noticed, you get fast write speeds for a few seconds, and then the stick heats up and presumably, to protect itself, it slows to (in my case) ~5MB/s. So that is the "real-world" speed even though these shysters chose to say "up to 150MB/s." Also, I wasn't able to use it on an unpowered USB hub (I AM able to use other USB sticks in that hub). I only gave it one star because it did test correctly for usable space, so it's not one of those Chinese fraud-sticks that get sold often.
customer_reviews.author: Girl Loving Life

customer_reviews.title: Not Always Recognized
customer_reviews.text: This flash drive works great when it works but it is not recognized by some devices. It works when I plug it directly into the USB port on my PC but not when I plug it into my powered USB hub that is plugged into my PC. It also is not recognized when I plug it into the USB port on the FEDEX Store printer. I wish they would replace it with one that is always recognized. BTW, my other USB flash drives all work in the locations that this one does not work.
customer_reviews.author: LM Guy

customer_reviews.title: Interesting Flash Drive
customer_reviews.text: It's a very small flash drive that has a kind of awkward holder but other than that flaw it works fast and has some decent capacity for the price. Also, it gives the option to secure your file within the flash drive which is certainly a very cool feature that I haven't used because my documents are not important, but it can be a great option to keep your files safe and off the cloud if that is what you want.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Torres

customer_reviews.title: Good, Fast Thumb Drive
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far! I've reformatted it several times and loaded different operating system install ISOs. I haven't experienced any of the overheating issues other people are reporting. Update: After about four months of infrequent use, the USB 3 connectivity has dropped off. USB 2.0 still works but if I want to use it in a 3.0 port, I have to lower it slowly into the jack just to get the computer to recognize it and it still only runs at 2.0 speed. From what I've read, this seems to be a common problem and I can most likely get an RMA, but it seems hardly with the time and effort of sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Compact USB drive that works without complications
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these USB drives. One was to create Mac OS bootable installs and the other was the watch movies on my TV. Both served it's purpose. They worked on my 2010 MacBook Pro, my 2014 MacBook Air, my PCs, both my LG and Vizio TVs and my Android box. Fast, efficient and easily portable. Cheaply priced too. I remember when these things use to cost a fortune! Love that we can get memory for so cheap now.
customer_reviews.author: MrNightLife

customer_reviews.title: Made short and successful work of updating vehicle's factory-installed Garmin navigation maps
customer_reviews.text: Garmin website stated download/upload process could take up to 3 hours. With this flash drive, the job was complete in just about 1 hour (46 min download; 12 min upload to vehicle). No additional formatting necessary (some YouTube videos stated flash drive might need to be formatted in fat32, but vehicle system and Garmin website did all the necessary work). The drive did get a little warm, but not dangerously so. I almost purchased a drive with more storage space, but the Garmin support website stated that the drive must be 16GB.
customer_reviews.author: EireAmericanLass

customer_reviews.title: If I could give it zero stars I would! ...
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it zero stars I would! I have had this for about 5 weeks now, saved a few files on it, and today it refuses to be read by any computer. All my files have been deleted...including important grade spreadsheets!!!! I am furious!!! STAY AWAY FROM THIS PRODUCT!!! I hope I can try and recover my student's grades somehow...this is absolutely ridiculous!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mag

customer_reviews.title: Fastest in my PC
customer_reviews.text: This is the fastest USB 3.0 I have run on my system. SanDisk Ultra Flair Read 116MB/s Write 72MB/s Samsung MUF-32BA/AM Read 96 Write 80 Samsung Duo MUF-32CB/AM Read 104 Write 88 Silicon Power Jewel J80 Read 104 Write 10 Patriot Tab Read 42 Write 21 Lexar Jump Drive S73 Read 36 Write 30 ADATA S102 Pro Read 64 Write 7
customer_reviews.author: Berny

customer_reviews.title: Hot hot hot! I will never choose a metal ...
customer_reviews.text: Hot hot hot! I will never choose a metal surface flash drive. I worry if it could burn my devices if I have to use it for a few hours. The reading speed to around 130mb, the writing speed is 70mb for the first 3 seconds, and then drop to 29mb forever. If I can return it, I would definitely return it, unfortunately, flash drives are not returnable products.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Thumb Drive
customer_reviews.text: I got the 128 GB version and it holds the right amount of stuff that I need. As a videographer, it's handy to have a place where I can dump everything and have a backup of each event. I highly recommend this product if you want something that is easy to use and is a great value for your money. This product is very sleek looking and I have no complaints in regard to the cosmetics of the device and in the actual use of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Dodson

customer_reviews.title: Will die before the year is out
customer_reviews.text: Bought a few dozen of these for use in my company. Use them to hold bootable OS images for installation. They don't get much use (every few days), but after less than a year, they just start dropping like flies. Like, DEAD, PC does not see it at all. And, not just one or two, but bunches of these. While this data isn't critical (basically DVD images), it's frustrating to grab one and wonder if it will work when I need it. Bought directly from Amazon, not a marketplace seller, so they should be legit. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mylrea

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly Small Flash Drive with 128GB storage
customer_reviews.text: This thing is crazy small and crazy good for a flash drive that holds 128 GB of data. In fact, it's so small that I am concerned about losing it. I am using it to backup the data on my home computer and it's incredible the amount of information it will hold. I recommend this SanDisk Flash Drive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoned in TN

customer_reviews.title: A waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money and time on these. I tried saving some photos and documents. As soon as I plugged them in, the mouse disappeared, then reappeared but the action was twitchy. The keyboard was no better, there was a huge delay between typing characters to add the file name and when the text would appear. When trying to check and see if the files were saved it took several attempts to open them. I bought a couple of Cruzer Slides and they work flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Mike T.

customer_reviews.title: Very fast, great capacity
customer_reviews.text: I bought four of these for a work project upgrading software on about 100 user desktop PCs; the only issue we had was actually that most of the PCs were USB 2.0 and our USB-device scan protocol took longer than we'd like, but that's nothing against these devices, just the hardware. They were perfect for the job, because we couldn't connect too many of the machines to the host server at once or it would get bogged down transferring the software. Four people and we still probably wouldn't have finished in one day without these things. On the USB 3.0 machines, they were super fast!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast transfer rates. Runs very hot!
customer_reviews.text: Compact, robust stainless steel shell and easy to manipulate shape. Performance is as rated. Quickly transfers using USB 3.0 interfaces. I use it as a boot drive for pfSense. Unfortunately, the flash drive runs very warm, hot actually. Uncomfortable to hold! This gives concern to its reliability in the long term. Be sure to have adequate ventilation. If used as an internal USB boot drive, it's recommended to have it in some form of air flow pathway within the chassis.
customer_reviews.author: WNG

customer_reviews.title: Small, sturdy & fast
customer_reviews.text: I needed an external drive that is large enough (256 GB) to transfer all my iTunes data from one computer to another, and chose this particular one because I had a positive experience with 128 GB one. I was a bit concerned reading reviews by others about the heating issue but decided to order one anyway, and I am glad I did. It doesn't get that hot even after using for hours of transmitting data back & forth, and it is solidly made and simple to use - plug it in, create ID & PW for protection and copy/paste or drag/drop. And, the data transfer speed is super fast. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Cali4ever

customer_reviews.title: Finally, one that actually runs a 3.0 speed as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a trustworthy USB that does what it's supposed to do, look no further. This device has integrity to its speed which is all I care about. At this point, I can't speak for its durability because I just recently received it. So we'll see how that goes. Overall I am very happy with it. I used it to download media creation tool and boot up my new PC with no issues. This thing is 16GB! And for its price definitely worth it. Few cons (but minor): - heats up fairly quickly if connected to the port for 15 minutes and over. - good built but could be slight better Okay that's all I have ^o^
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this purchase. It worked briefly and then said it needed to be formatted. Windows could not format it. When I looked in disk management it shows 0 bytes free and 0 bytes used. I have not been able to find a solution and it is worthless now. It also gets very hot in the usb 3 port.
customer_reviews.author: Kathie Park

customer_reviews.title: SanDisk For The Win
customer_reviews.text: Storage capacity as a star rating? You get what you pay for lol. SanDisk is a top brand for all flash media. I recommend all of their products. This flash drive performs extremely well at USB 3.0 speeds. A HUGE upgrade from my USB 2.0 SanDisk Cruzer that is still kickin even after being washed twice. The compact design and material makes it feel very high quality. I'd expect this one to last just as long if not longer.
customer_reviews.author: Jasen

customer_reviews.title: Beware!!! No protective covering.
customer_reviews.text: I want to give this product 5 stars. There’s a lot that I love about it. My only disappointment is that there is no cover to protect the contact point to the computer port. I’m carrying it in a very unsophisticated plastic baggie to ensure no static buildup, dust or sand damage it and render it unusable. As such, it will only be a temporary device for me because I can’t risk losing the info I transport on it, and aside from the initial usage it was a waste of money since I will be discarding it rather than risk damage and loss of info.
customer_reviews.author: Cic626

customer_reviews.title: doesn't disperse heat effectively
customer_reviews.text: First flash drive came broken. It wouldn't register on any 3.0 or 3.1 port and got insanely hot when I plugged it into either, but hey that happens. Replacement came quickly and without hassle so kudos to seller. As for the (replacement) product itself, small, compact, as advertised. Only thing i would note (and this is why it's loosing a star) is it doesn't disperse heat very well and when your transferring data for long periods it really heats up. We'll see how it holds up over time and i may change my review to reflect long term performance.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: Extremely fast read & write data profiles.
customer_reviews.text: I got these on sale. Was a one time offer at that time. A BOGO offer. Which was great as I was building a computer from the case up and needed this USB drive to install Win 10. In the days of yör, all you needed to do was just set the bios to load from the CD, pop the CD in the drive and fire the computer up and that was it, not now. Technology has advanced but has not gotten really that much faster or easier.
customer_reviews.author: Icenesis Wayons

customer_reviews.title: This is what a USB drive should be like.
customer_reviews.text: So far, it's retained it's high-speed 3.0 transfer speeds all the way through transferring a little over 100GB of video files repeatedly. I was quite surprised at that, since it's so small; I actually assumed it would heat up and slow down. The brushed aluminum prevents fingerprints and looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Harwood

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied my needs as a file sharing mechanism for files too big for free cloud space.
customer_reviews.text: Its a thumb drive - its not going to be as fast as your USB 3 hard drives. The price is OK, and I have SanDisk thumb drives and camera memories, that have lasted for many years. Its physically small. I reformatted it to ExFAT with Disk Utility in an iMac, so that I could send some very large video files to a friend. I was able to play the copied files from the Thumb drive on a cheap windows 10 laptop - so it had the functionality I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: Item Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Really fast, but really hot.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1) Very, very fast for the price. 2) Quite compact for a 64 GB drive. Cons: 1) It has no cap and no case, so you have to be careful to prevent damage to the unit. 2) I'd forgotten to check before purchasing as to whether it has an in-use indicator light; it does not. 3) It gets quite hot when transferring large amounts of data, which can't be good for either the flash drive or the PC. When removing it, try to touch the plastic grip at the end, and not the metal body; and don't put it down before allowing it a few seconds to cool down.
customer_reviews.author: Linda NYC

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but needs a cover
customer_reviews.text: This is very tiny for as much as it holds. I'm very happy about that. I do wish there was some kind of cover to go over the tip that gets inserted into the USB Port so that it doesn't accidentally get damaged. Overall, easy enough to use. I did have to update the stick before I used it. Sorry I can't be more specific, I'm just not super technical and don't know why I had to do that, but I did and it was simple, LOL.
customer_reviews.author: ADM

customer_reviews.title: I Feel that I wasted my money
customer_reviews.text: Dissatisfied with this purchase. Bought it to transfer some music onto, but after the music was transferred it could not be read by any of the devices it was plugged into. I ended up having to delete the thousands of songs that were placed on it. Worse it was done for me by a friend and I had to ask for them to be redone on another drive.
customer_reviews.author: Jacinta

customer_reviews.title: Great Drive. One Piece Metal Body.
customer_reviews.text: I chose those USB drive because it did not have a movable and breakable USB connector. I used this for loading Windows 10 onto a new computer build. No problems creating a Windows 10 install usb or creating the OS on a new computer with the USB 3.0 speed. A Fast, no error install of OS with this drive. A little overkill in size since you only need 8gb in 2020 for Windows 10 but i like having the option to use it for regular storage. My plan is to use this as an OS backup for future computers or if computers have problems booting.
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: Speeds drop dramatically off after 1GB - Avoid for Large Files
customer_reviews.text: If all u want is a small size and decent capacity drive, this will do the trick. If you also want speed, then look elsewhere, while transfering files larger than 500MB, speeds go down from ~30MB/s to ~3.5MB/s after 500MB. Good drive to store a lot of small files (smaller than 1GB), not good for moving large files.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip M

customer_reviews.title: Dependable large (32GB) USB flash drive, but no cap and gets hot
customer_reviews.text: IMO, SanDisk is the best for flash drives and memory cards. They have never let me down. This one, the SanDisk Ultra Flair 32GB USB 3.0 Flash Drive, is fast and dependable, works well with all of our PCs and OS - from Win7 thru Win10. The only issue with this particular flash drive is that it gets very hot while in use. For the size and speed and quality and price, this is an excellent flash drive, I just wish it didn't heat up.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick D.

customer_reviews.title: Nice and small for easy use.
customer_reviews.text: I use a thumb drive for pc builds and place all the drivers and things needed to reboot the pc. I also install them in the pc so customers always know where it is in case they need the programs. This driver is crazy small and easy to hide in the pc. Smaller than the size of a AAA battery it's great and fits nicely in the pocket or keychain for travel. I just wish it had a cover. Also, it can get quite hot if you leave it in a pc. I recommend taking it out when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Rico

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy, becomes corrupt over time
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this flash drive since September of last year when I purchased it. I am an IT Technician and it is now a corrupted flash drive because I can't deploy an image from it after multiple times. All other flash drives work, but this brand does not.
customer_reviews.author: Wendysmf

customer_reviews.title: Garbage, waisted time and money, SKIP !
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed by the reviews and ordered a 64gb version. However I was not able to use it at all! Spend half day trying to connect with MacBook pro, iMac and Windows laptop but non of them recognized this flash drive. Googled and found that this item does not go threw a regular quality testing and shipped as is. Extremely angry and mad with this scrap and garbage device! I wanted to buy a model I knew but messed with the reviews - my loose now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keep it Coool
customer_reviews.text: Drive has decent speed and very cheap for this type drive. It does get very warm. Put it on a Sabrent drive bay or something simpler. The drive will damage itself over a period of time due to the heat and may make it difficult to retrieve files, but they're still there. You don't loose files, just access to them bcs of overheated circuits (and silicone) pathways.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Thom

customer_reviews.title: Runs Hot, Incorrect Capacity for the Drive
customer_reviews.text: Bought the drive for 64 Gigs, both the package and the drive say 64 gigs on them, however when it is pluged into the computer, it only reads 32 gigabytes. Clearly an incorrect statement and overcharging for the lower capacity drive. When pluged in, runs very hot, reading/writting speeds are way lower than advertised. Upd. Got contacted by the seller, and got a refund for manufacturing error. Bumping my review to 3 stars as the product still runs hot without the advertised transfer speeds, but now the size error is resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Taras Priadka

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a little over 1 year with little use - Then completely failed
customer_reviews.text: This Flash Drive worked fine for over a year until one day it just didn't work at all. I saw a lot of these problems in the early days of thumb drives (back when they were typically 2 gb). I found that SanDisk was the exception and stuck with them. This particular model failed completely, and all the data on the drive is unreadable. I still think SanDisk makes good drives, but I will pick a different model for my next purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin

customer_reviews.title: Was able to make a bootable image
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to create a bootable image, to use in emergency situations in case my computer's hard drive failed. The software that I was using (Acronis) didn't work at first, but going through some extra instructions on their web site fixed the issue. (basically, I had to just re-format the drive in exFat format.) I didn't run any tests to confirm, but when copying files to the drive, it seems fairly fast.
customer_reviews.author: Hopeful, but Cynic

customer_reviews.title: The worst cheese grater on the market.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it is indeed a 16gb flash drive that supports USB 3.0 speeds. If you need something that is a flash drive, holds 16gb of data, and utilizes the speeds of USB 3.0, then this is the product for you. If none of those things are the things you want out of a thing, don't buy this thing. It is not a cheese grater nor a paperweight, but instead it is a flash drive that will hold 16gb of data and utilize USB 3.0 speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Rand Jones

customer_reviews.title: GREAT.
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered 3 of these, the 128gb. They are wonderful, and I plan to buy more as I change out older, smaller capacity flash drives. I operate with 2 racks of USB hubs, 4 flash drives in each. My 2 cents on the concern for their getting warm, is simply that this model is not covered up in plastic, and so you are touching the metal directly, and so you feel the warmth that is going to be there in any style. It has not concerned me. Also these fit snugly into their port, whereas others that I have, including same brand, do not, and the others lose connection.
customer_reviews.author: n.b.

customer_reviews.title: This is TINY
customer_reviews.text: This thing is tiny. It's about width of my pinky but half the length. Easy to lose. Stopped working after 3 weeks. No computer would read it. Lost all my files. Had to format, then returned it. I wondered if because it was so tiny, if it could overheat? Not sure if that's possible, but anyways....this purchase was a bust. When it worked it was fast, yes.
customer_reviews.author: Y. L.

customer_reviews.title: No Problems With It
customer_reviews.text: I tend to reserve my 5-star ratings for something really exceptional. It's a flash drive. It works as expected. No problems. Capacity as advertised. Arrived on time. (Flash drives can sometimes be a problem with initial formatting or whatever; none such with this product.) SanDIsk has been around awhile; I sort of trust the name for flash drives and memory cards..
customer_reviews.author: aprimeclient

customer_reviews.title: Ok performance, nothing special
customer_reviews.text: HD Tune reports this as about 2x the speed of my generic USB 2.0 thumb drive topping out at a max speed of 76.9 and averaging 51.7 MB/sec. Certainly not 15 x as claimed. But it's good capacity, and it IS faster than USB 2, even faster than an ADATA USB 3 drive that tops at 42.7. As others have reported, it did get quite hot during the short test.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality but a little slow
customer_reviews.text: Serves the purpose of housing gigabytes of MP3s for use on my PlayStation 4 using the Media Player app. It is a little slow though, and I rarely see it reach 10 mbps when plugged into a USB 3.0 port -- however the nice build quality alone is enough for me to overlook the slow write speed. Another plus about them is on a laptop that has two side by side USB ports I can plugin two of these flash drives side by side and there's no issue whatsoever with them not fitting.
customer_reviews.author: Claudetta

customer_reviews.title: Of course it gets hot, it's metal...
customer_reviews.text: It works as it's supposed to, has the amount of storage it's supposed to, and I'm pleased with it. Of course it's going to get hot when in use, it's metal, which conducts heat. It does what it's supposed to, don't let the claims of it getting hot deter you from choosing this one. It's super small and looks nice. I would totally buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very annoying when drive unmounts during file transfer
customer_reviews.text: Item runs extremely hot when transferring Gb files. Item unmounts frequently too. I’ve formatted different types and all unmount. Very annoying when drive unmounts during file transfer. I wouldn’t bother buying this disk. Every other scandisk product I’ve purchased has worked flawlessly except this one.
customer_reviews.author: Clark

customer_reviews.title: Failed to Work Within a Few Months
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a few months and then just suddenly stopped working when I was transferring some files. Went online to find a fix but none of them worked. PC kept giving me the "USB device not recognized" message. The aluminum body might look nice but it contributes to absorbing a lot of heat and I think that's the reason mine (and most reviews here) failed. I suggest you look at other USB drives and don't get this one.
customer_reviews.author: CK893

customer_reviews.title: Got it for one thing and used it got a healthy sleep aid for my dad.
customer_reviews.text: Got this to put music on for my dad. He needs ambient/hypnotic music to sleep. Got this initially to make a bootstick for my laptop but since it's got a year warranty on it I can make a bootstick for linux later. I used this ti load about 70 hrs of ambient hypnotic sleep and relaxation music. He loves it. Hes slept better in the last two weeks than the last 2 years
customer_reviews.author: Brianne Conlon

customer_reviews.title: Too hot to touch. Super slow writing.  Appears to be USB 2 speed
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This is the first USB flash drive I've ever purchased that I didn't like. Attempted to copy 24 GB of files using a USB 3 port and its telling me it should finish in one day under Windows 7 64 bit. The progress bar is hardly moving. Very disappointing. Its definitely not working properly. Thought the bad reviews were nitpicking. They're not. It's also extremely hot. It shouldn't get so hot it hurts your fingers.
customer_reviews.author: sampleaccurate

customer_reviews.title: The speed and performance is incredible.
customer_reviews.text: I do IT for a living, we carry around portable flash drives for application installation and imaging. I thought there was a fluke at first. I imaged an entire machine in 2 min and 14 seconds. This was an entire Win 10 Enterprise disk with well over 65 gigs. I told my self there is no way this was complete. Too my surprise it was, where the company standard portable usb drives took all of 17min. Lets just say they prefer using my USB stick.
customer_reviews.author: J. Black

product_meta.title: SanDisk Ultra Flair 16GB USB 3.0 Flash Drive - SDCZ73-016G-G46,Black
product_meta.description: Size:16GBThe SanDisk Ultra Flair USB 3.0 flash drive moves your files fast. Spend less time waiting to transfer files and enjoy high-speed USB 3.0 performance of up to 130MB/s. Transfer a fulllength movie to the drive faster than standard USB 2.0 drives. Its durable and sleek metal casing is tough enough to handle knocks with style. And, with password protection, you can rest assured that your private files stay private. Help secure files in style with the SanDisk Ultra Flair USB 3.0 flash drive.
feature_bullets: Transfer to drive faster up to 15X faster than standard USB 2.0 drives
Easy-to-use password protection for your private files

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars32,662 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
